entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 110 to 170 mm of rain, especially in the ranges. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40 mm/h in possible localised downpours from this afternoon through to early Sunday morning, with thunderstorms also possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 90 to 140 mm of rain, especially in the ranges, but 170 mm possible in the Wairoa District. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40 mm/h in possible localised downpours. Thunderstorms expected today and will increase the risk of downpours. Note, heavy rain easing south of the Wairoa District late this evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Warning period extended for the Wairoa District and risk of upgrade increased from minimal to low - mainly for the Wairoa District.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Thunderstorms are possible about parts of Hawke's Bay this afternoon. For Cape Kidnappers area and inland Hawke's Bay from Napier southwards there is a risk of SEVERE thunderstorms or localised downpours during the afternoon bringing rain with intensities of 25 to 35 mm per hour. Conditions should ease early evening.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Unstable conditions are expected during the afternoon as a low crosses the northern North Island and some thunderstorms are expected. For the east and south of Northland south of Kerikeri and Auckland there is a chance some of these thunderstorms will become SEVERE this afternoon, bringing localised downpours with intensities of 25 to 40 mm per hour. The thunderstorms should ease early evening.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 05:22 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near GISBORNE, WHANGARA, WAIMATA and OFFSHORE GISBORNE.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the southwest, and are expected to lie near GISBORNE, WHANGARA, WAIMATA and OFFSHORE GISBORNE at 05:52 pm and near GISBORNE, WHANGARA, WAIMATA, KANAKANAIA and OFFSHORE GISBORNE at 06:22 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by torrential rain and frequent lightning.
Impact:
Torrential rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Frequent lightning is dangerous to people and livestock, especially those exposed outdoors or on the water, and can cause power surges and damage to electrical equipment.

These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by torrential rain and hail.
Impact:

Hail can cause damage to crops, orchards and vines and may make driving conditions hazardous.
